column4: Icahn sweetens offer for Federal-Mogul for third time
column5: Billionaire Carl Icahn's investment firm  Icahn Enterprises LP   sweetened its offer for a third time to buy shares of Federal-Mogul Holdings Corp  it does not already own.

column4: Inotek's eye drug fails late-stage study  shares sink
column5: Inotek Pharmaceuticals Corp's shares plunged 71 percent to a record low on Tuesday after the company said its lead experimental drug failed a late-stage study  citing a stronger-than-expected placebo effect.

column4: Intel to take stake in German mapping firm HERE in automated driving push
column5: FRANKFURT U.S. chip maker Intel  will take a 15 percent stake in German digital mapping firm HERE  it said on Tuesday  as it seeks to build its presence in automated driving technology.

column4: DoubleLine Total Return bleeds $3.5 billion  biggest monthly outflow ever
column5: NEW YORK The DoubleLine Total Return Bond Fund posted a net outflow of $3.5 billion in December  its biggest one-month withdrawal ever  data from research firm Morningstar showed on Tuesday.

column4: Tesla posts 9.4 percent fall in quarterly deliveries
column5: Tesla Motors Inc  said on Tuesday fourth-quarter deliveries fell 9.4 percent due to short-term production hurdles from the transition to a new autopilot hardware.

column4: Alcoa to close Suralco refinery in Suriname
column5: Alcoa Corp said it would permanently close its Suralco alumina refinery and bauxite mines in Suriname  more than a year after stopping production at the plant.

column4: Credit Suisse  AstraZeneca among top BofA-ML's top European picks for first quarter
column5: LONDON Credit Suisse and AstraZeneca are among Bank of America-Merrill Lynch's top picks for the first quarter of 2017  as the market is overly pessimistic on both stocks  according to analysts at the bank.

column4: ETFs globally gather record cash in 2016 -BlackRock
column5: NEW YORK Investors funneled $375 billion into exchange-traded funds in  2016  investment manager BlackRock Inc said on Tuesday  a global record that came as investors looked to cut costs.

column4: Credit Suisse  AstraZeneca among top BofA-ML's top European picks for first quarter
column5: LONDON Credit Suisse and AstraZeneca are among Bank of America-Merrill Lynch's top picks for the first quarter of 2017  as the market is overly pessimistic on both stocks  according to analysts at the bank.

column4: Refiner Delek to buy rest of Alon USA for $464 million
column5: Refiner Delek U.S. Holdings Inc said it had agreed to buy the shares of Alon USA Energy Inc it does not already own for $464 million to increase its exposure to cheap crude produced in Texas's prolific Permian basin.

column4: U.S. fines TransUnion  Equifax for deceit over credit scores
column5: A U.S. regulator on Tuesday ordered credit reporting agencies TransUnion  and Equifax Inc  to pay more than $23.2 million in fines and restitution for deceiving consumers about the usefulness and cost of credit scores they bought.

column4: Chided by Trump  Ford scraps Mexico factory  adds Michigan jobs
column5: FLAT ROCK  Mich./WASHINGTON Ford Motor Co  on Tuesday scrapped a planned Mexican car factory and added 700 jobs in Michigan following criticism by Donald Trump  as the U.S. president-elect turned his attention toward rival General Motors Co  with the threat of a "big border tax" over compact cars made in Mexico. | Video

column4: Ford scraps plan for $1.6 billion plant in Mexico after Trump criticism
column5: FLAT ROCK  Mich./WASHINGTON Ford Motor Co  said Tuesday it will cancel a planned $1.6 billion factory in Mexico and invest $700 million at a Michigan factory  after President-elect Donald Trump had harshly criticized the Mexico investment plan.

column4: Mexico's peso deepens losses after Ford scraps Mexican plant plan
column5: MEXICO CITY Mexico's peso fell on Tuesday to touch its weakest level in seven weeks after Ford   the second-largest U.S. automaker  said it will cancel a planned $1.6 billion factory in Mexico's central state of San Luis Potosi.

column4: Trump assails GM over car production in Mexico  threatens tax
column5: DETROIT/WASHINGTON President-elect Donald Trump on Tuesday threatened to impose a "big border tax" on General Motors Co  for making some of its Chevrolet Cruze compact cars in Mexico  an arrangement the largest U.S. automaker defended as part of its strategy to serve global customers  not sell them in the United States.

column4: Indonesia penalizes JPMorgan for negative report in latest emerging markets skirmish
column5: JAKARTA/NEW YORK Indonesia has cut some ties with JPMorgan Chase & Co  after the bank's research analysts issued a negative report on the country  the latest in a series of skirmishes between Wall Street banks and governments in emerging markets.

column4: Marathon Petroleum explores Speedway spin amid Elliott pressure
column5: Marathon Petroleum Corp  announced a series of steps to increase its stock price  including the possible separation of its Speedway retail business  amid pressure from hedge fund Elliott Management.

column4: McDonald's opens near Vatican  upsetting some purists
column5: VATICAN CITY McDonald's has opened a franchise just steps away from the gleaming white marble dome of St. Peter's Basilica  giving indigestion to some cardinals and local business owners.

column4: SM Energy to sell some Eagle Ford assets for $800 million
column5: U.S. oil and gas producer SM Energy Co  said on Tuesday it would sell certain assets in the Eagle Ford shale of South Texas to a unit of KKR  for $800 million.

column4: Marathon Petroleum explores Speedway spin amid Elliott pressure
column5: Marathon Petroleum Corp  announced a series of steps to increase its stock price  including the possible separation of its Speedway retail business  amid pressure from hedge fund Elliott Management.

column4: EU regulators delay ChemChina/Syngenta merger decision to April 12
column5: BRUSSELS European Union antitrust regulators have extended the deadline for a decision on ChemChina's proposed buy of Swiss pesticides and seeds group Syngenta by 10 working days to April 12.

column4: U.S. fines TransUnion  Equifax for deceit over credit scores
column5: A U.S. regulator on Tuesday ordered credit reporting agencies TransUnion  and Equifax Inc  to pay more than $23.2 million in fines and restitution for deceiving consumers about the usefulness and cost of credit scores they bought.

column4: Twitter's China boss Kathy Chen quits after eight months
column5: NEW YORK/BEIJING Twitter Inc  executive Kathy Chen  brought in to run Greater China just over eight months ago  has quit  according to a tweet sent by her over the weekend. | Video
